reviews.sentence: Needs Work. This hotel only has location to sell. Right across the street from the Baseball park. The toilet ran all night tub did not drain well. Loud obnoxious customers in their bar restaurant with no wait staff for the tables after the ball game. Got to love the location.

Great hotel near the stadiums. Room was nice and clean. Bed and pillows very comfortable. We stayed here to walk to the stadium. Saved us the hassle and cost of parking there. There is a hill to go up down on the walk.

Perfect location if going to a ball game. This is not your typical Four Points it is a remodeled older property. They have a Boulevard Grill which is neat. Taco Bell in the parking lot and the baseball and football stadiums are literally across the street so you can walk. The rooms are small bathrooms are small and they were not really clean. It was good enough for a late night arrival and one nights sleep but if you are not going to a ball game I would stay elsewhere.

Walkable to Kaufman Stadium. No frills and dated but clean and comfortable. An easy walk to Kaufman Stadium which was why we chose it. Not really close to much of anything else. Parking was easy and since it is right next to the freeway it was easy to get to the hotel or on the freeway to get somewhere else. Clean and comfortable. Walkable to the Sports Complex Chiefs and Royals.
Perfect hotel for baseball. Perfect hotel for our needs. We needed a hotel for the baseball game across the street. The price was right and the parking was free.

We asked for an early check in of 1 pm we ended up arriving at 5 pm they did not have our room ready when check in is 3 or 4 pm The game started at 615 pm 7415 luckily they rushed the cleaning person s. there is no shampoo in the shower and the shower curtain has rust stains on the bottom as well as what looks like mold. Nice and close to the ball park but a lot more staff on game weekends would benefit you greatly. 25 stars.

Great place near KC Zoo and Starlight Theater. When we stayed the tornado sirens went off and we went to the lower level. The staff was courteous kind knowledgeable and comforting. They were very professional and my family and I felt comforted by their quick actions and kindness. We will certainly be back and continue to use this chain. The staff was amazing and extremely courteous. KC Zoo Swope Park Starlight Theater Kaufman Stadium and Arrowhead Stadium. Not really.
KC trip. We were there to see a KC Royals game. It was close to the ball park we walked to stadium. The guy at the check in desk was very friendly and answered our questions.

Perfect Location for Royals or Chiefs Games. The location of the hotel is perfect for walking to Royals and Chiefs games. The officially policed crossing to the stadium car parks is only about 100 yards away. Most people take a short cut to the car pack down a steep grassy bank. If this is too steep for you then it is only a little further to use the road. Location perfect. The staff were friendly the pool was a bonus and the bar had beer specials that made it even easier to stop for a pre post game beer or cocktail. The room had one of those noisy aircon units on the floor not a problem for a heavy sleeper like me but my wife and daughter did wake up quite a bit. Also we were on the road side so the traffic noise was high. You can not have a great location without this downside though. No breakfast. The prices have crept up since the Royals started doing well and you need to book a long time in advance on game days. I gave this hotel a 4 but this was possibly a bit generous but the location is SO good it tipped the balance.

Excellent location across from the ball park. Very pleasant stay. We liked being able to walk to the games and did not have to pay the stadium parking fee. Location cleanliness We attended 3 ball games and toured KC during the day. The bar and grill was slower than molasses. For some reason it was about 20 higher to book the room directly than through Expedia when we decided to.
Exceptional. Friendly staff always available. Parking late at night was always far away from the only one door available.

Close to the ball parks. After reading other reviews we were Leary of this hotel but decided to stay anyway because of its close proximity to the ball parks. However we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff was nice and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable. The only problem was the bar closed at 10 pm after a night baseball game. However Carie did her best to accommodate everyone. Being close to the ball parks We walked to the baseball game. Going across the busy street over the fence and down the hill was a bit of a challenge. But still beat driving The bar and kitchen stay open later on game days.

There was a storm that went through the area right before we arrived and so there were problems with the Wifi. could not find an ice machine or a vending machine. Our room was on the lower level and there was always a lot of noise because the laundry room was down the hall. It was close to the Stadium and had a nice restaurant in the hotel. The only advantage was it was close to stadium. There was nothing else around shopping other restaurants etc. More clarification on parking location of room hours of the restaurant etc.

This is a good hotel. The road to the hotel is easy to miss I drove past it twice. The parking is odd and will likely force you to walk quite a ways to the front entrance and I could not find another entrance I could use. The lobby is really nice. We got there around 90 pm and had to wait a little bit for someone to come to the front desk to check us in. The room was nice and clean exactly what we had hope for. Great room. Only problem I had was the bath was only like a foot deep. Though I did not use the pool there was a lot of people there I saw who did use it so it must be decent at least. The location is great if you are there for a game you could walk to the Cardinals stadium. Staff was friendly.

A great bed covers a multitude of sins. This hotel has seen better days. But you it seems you can count on Sheraton to give you a very good bed. And for that it covers a multitude of sins in my book. The bathroom was not great and the shower did not drain properly which I notified staff 3 times with over the course of my 3 night stay. It was never resolved. The hotel was close to the freeway which made access easy. Parking was a problem some nights. The hotel is right next to the big MLB and NFL stadiums and since there were no games on the weekend we were there it was quiet. The rates were good too. Overall it could have been better but was good value for money. And if you give me a comfortable bed I will overlook many of the other flaws.
Management is rude. Charges you 25 dollars to park car there 1 hour past check out. They will lie to your face about why they charge it.

Great staff and location. Had a great time. staff there is amazing. Friendly and very helpful. Also loved being only a short walk to the Chiefs game. Not having to deal with parking at the game was a Godsend. Only thing I did not like was there was no place to hang a towel or robe or anything in the bathroom. the small task of putting up a few hooks would be well worth it.
Excellent. Location to both Kansas City stadiums. Parking lot sketchy but the car was fine.
Disgusting balcony doors locked from outside and rude staff. Run down building and parking lot. Cancelled as soon as we pulled up.

A decent hotel right across the street from baseball football stadiums so it is very convenient if that is what you are going to KC for. There were a lot of renovations going on while I was there but the room was clean and the staff was friendly and accommodating. No free breakfast that I saw however. Instead there is a restaurant bar inside the hotel if you want to eat. there is a Taco Bell and a Burger King in the same parking lot as the hotel if you need something quick to eat.
